intro: Oldenlandia strumosa, commonly known as the silverleaf spiderwort, is a flowering plant native to tropical and subtropical regions. It belongs to the family Commelinaceae and is characterized by its small, showy white or pink flowers. The plant has slender, often hairy stems and lance-shaped leaves that are usually covered in a fine layer of white wax. It thrives in moist, shady environments and is often found in wetlands or along stream banks. Its unique appearance and adaptability make it a notable species in its native habitats.
